newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: NetComm shares soar after merger.
newsitem.headline: NetComm shares soar after merger.

text.p: Shares in modem maker NetComm Ltd soared by about 33 percent after its announced a merger with fellow modem group Banksia Technologies Pty Ltd.
At 1.30 p.m. (0330 GMT), NetComm shares were 20 cents or 33.33 percent at 80 cents on light volume.
Under the merger terms, Banksia managing director David Stewart would end up as the principal shareholder of the company.
Estimates show that the merged group would have the largest share of Australia's modem market.
